pages.text: The least you need to do to use game mode is the basic configuration. $(br)I'll describe how you do that in this chapter. $(br2)First you have to meet these requirements: $(br)$(li)A Minecraft Server (either you create one yourself, play over LAN or $(l:bugs_feedback/server)get one hosted$() $(li)Operator rights on the server

The next steps are the basic configuration in-game: $(br2)1. Place one Nexus in each team base $(br)2. Create the teams: $(o)$(3)/team add <team> [displayName]$() $(br)3. Assign a color to the teams: $(o)$(3)/team modify <team> color [color]$() $(br)4. Assign all players to the teams: $(o)$(3)/team join <team> [playerName]$() $(br)5. Further configuration is possible with the $(l:gamemode_configuration/server_config_options)server config$() and $(l:gamemode_configuration/additional_configuration)additional commands$()

The basic configuration is now complete, each player should now go to their base and things can start from there. $(br2)The game mode is called $(n)Tower Defense Battle Mode$() and the goal of the game is to find the enemy bases and destroy the Nexus there before your own is destroyed!
